name: trove
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a large amount of something good, useful, or valuable, or a place where this can be found: The college holds a vast trove of documents relating to the politician. One of the largest troves of consumer data is kept by a Colorado market research firm. The castle in Bavaria turned out to be a particularly rich trove, filled with art stolen from the Rothschilds in Paris. See also
treasure trove
More examplesFewer examplesThere wasn't a pile of cash in the room or a trove of jewels stashed in a safe.The company's most valuable asset was its trove of Beatles songs.She came across a trove of Fanny Brice letters at the New York Public Library.
